haxel.HxlText

type
class
extends
HxlSprite
Extends HxlSprite to support rendering text. Can tint, fade, rotate and scale just like a sprite. Doesn't really animate though, as far as I know. Also does nice pixel-perfect centering on pixel fonts as long as they are only one liners.

Constructor

public new(X : Float, Y : Float, Width : Int, ?Text : String, ?EmbeddedFont : Bool)
parameters
X The X position of the text.
Y The Y position of the text.
Width The width of the text object (height is determined automatically).
Text The actual text you would like to display initially.
EmbeddedFont Whether this text field uses embedded fonts or nto
Creates a new HxlText object at the specified position.

inherited from haxel.HxlObject

public scale : HxlPoint

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
Change the size of your sprite's graphic. NOTE: Scale doesn't currently affect collisions automatically, you will need to adjust the width, height and offset manually. WARNING: scaling sprites decreases rendering performance for this sprite by a factor of 10x!

public scaleVelocity : HxlPoint

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite

public scrollFactor : HxlPoint

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
A point that can store numbers from 0 to 1 (for X and Y independently) that governs how much this object is affected by the camera subsystem. 0 means it never moves, like a HUD element or far background graphic. 1 means it scrolls along a the same speed as the foreground layer. scrollFactor is initialized as (1,1) by default.

public scrollFactor : HxlPoint

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
A point that can store numbers from 0 to 1 (for X and Y independently) that governs how much this object is affected by the camera subsystem. 0 means it never moves, like a HUD element or far background graphic. 1 means it scrolls along a the same speed as the foreground layer. scrollFactor is initialized as (1,1) by default.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

public addAnimation(Name : String, Frames : Array<Int>, ?FrameRate : Float, ?Looped : Bool) : Void

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
parameters
Name What this animation should be called (e.g. "run").
Frames An array of numbers indicating what frames to play in what order (e.g. 1, 2, 3).
FrameRate The speed in frames per second that the animation should play at (e.g. 40 fps).
Looped Whether or not the animation is looped or just plays once.
Adds a new animation to the sprite.

public addAnimationCallback(AnimationCallback : Dynamic) : Void

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
parameters
AnimationCallback A function that has 3 parameters: a string name, a Int frame number, and a Int frame index.
Pass in a function to be called whenever this sprite's animation changes.

public createGraphic(Width : Int, Height : Int, ?Color : Int, ?Unique : Bool, ?Key : String) : HxlSprite

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
parameters
Width The width of the sprite you want to generate.
Height The height of the sprite you want to generate.
Color Specifies the color of the generated block.
Unique Whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache.
Key Optional parameter - specify a string key to identify this graphic in the cache. Trumps Unique flag.
returns
This HxlSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
This function creates a flat colored square image dynamically.

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
parameters
Brush The image you want to use as a brush or stamp or pen or whatever.
X The X coordinate of the brush's top left corner on this sprite.
Y They Y coordinate of the brush's top left corner on this sprite.
This function draws or stamps one HxlSprite onto another. This function is NOT intended to replace render()!

public loadGraphic(Graphic : Class<flash.display.Bitmap>, ?Animated : Bool, ?Reverse : Bool, ?Width : Int, ?Height : Int, ?Unique : Bool) : HxlSprite

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
parameters
Graphic The image you want to use.
Animated Whether the Graphic parameter is a single sprite or a row of sprites.
Reverse Whether you need this class to generate horizontally flipped versions of the animation frames.
Width OPTIONAL - Specify the width of your sprite (helps HxlSprite figure out what to do with non-square sprites or sprite sheets).
Height OPTIONAL - Specify the height of your sprite (helps HxlSprite figure out what to do with non-square sprites or sprite sheets).
Unique Whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache.
returns
This HxlSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
Load an image from an embedded graphic file.

public loadRotatedGraphic(Graphic : Class<flash.display.Bitmap>, ?Rotations : Int, ?Frame : Int, ?AntiAliasing : Bool, ?AutoBuffer : Bool) : HxlSprite

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
parameters
Graphic The image you want to rotate & stamp.
Frames The number of frames you want to use (more == smoother rotations).
Offset Use this to select a specific frame to draw from the graphic.
AntiAliasing Whether to use high quality rotations when creating the graphic.
AutoBuffer Whether to automatically increase the image size to accomodate rotated corners.
returns
This HxlSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
Create a pre-rotated sprite sheet from a simple sprite. This can make a huge difference in graphical performance!

public play(AnimName : String, ?Force : Bool) : Void

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
parameters
AnimName The string name of the animation you want to play.
Force Whether to force the animation to restart.
Plays an existing animation (e.g. "run"). If you call an animation that is already playing it will be ignored.

public setFont(Font : String) : String

public setFormat(?Font : String, ?Size : Int, ?Color : Int, ?Alignment : String, ?ShadowColor : Int) : HxlText

parameters
Font The name of the font face for the text display.
Size The size of the font (in pixels essentially).
Color The color of the text in traditional flash 0xRRGGBB format.
Alignment A string representing the desired alignment ("left,"right" or "center").
ShadowColor A Int representing the desired text shadow color in flash 0xRRGGBB format.
returns
This HxlText instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
You can use this if you have a lot of text parameters to set instead of the individual properties.

public unsafeBind(Pixels : flash.display.BitmapData) : Void

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
parameters
Pixels The BitmapData object you want to point at.
Internal function, currently only used to quickly update HxlState.screen for post-processing. Potentially super-unsafe, since it doesn't call resetHelpers()!

public update() : Void

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
Main game loop update function. Override this to create your own sprite logic! Just don't forget to call super.update() or any of the helper functions.

private updateAnimation() : Void

inherited from haxel.HxlSprite
Internal function for updating the sprite's animation. Useful for cases when you need to update this but are buried down in too many supers. This function is called automatically by HxlSprite.update().

private updateMotion() : Void

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
Internal function for updating the position and speed of this object. Useful for cases when you need to update this but are buried down in too many supers.
